item.description:
You are invited to join in this free Scarborough Adult Ed workshop taught by permaculture group member Mark Follansbee!  Remember - you can RSVP here but it would be great if you could confirm your attendance directly on the Scarborough Adult Ed web site also! Apparently space is limited.

Why pay for fertilizer and compost? If you’ve never composted before, winter’s the time to get started on making your own, in preparation for spring gardens. Prepare free, nutrient-rich garden amendments while reducing kitchen waste. Learn to build a worm bin for less than $15 and keep it trouble-free. We’ll discuss feeding and monitoring your bin, harvesting and using vermicompost as a soil amendment, and making vermicompost tea; plenty of time for questions and addressing rumors and myths about vermicomposting. Optional “red wigglers” can be ordered from instructor at $20 for the one pound recommended.

group.name: Portland Maine Permaculture & The Resilience Hub

item.name: Vermicomposting: Year-Round Composting with Worms
